column2: parisdaisy8, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have not had major problems with acne but since being on this drug my chin and and jaw line are full of cystic acne. Its painful.  I had spotting before the 4th week of placeholders pills.

column2: Elon0606, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have found this brand of BC to be great. I've been on it 5 years.  I do have acne that is a little worse than normal around my mouth/jaw (one a month) but everything else is good. column2: sierra, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This pill has me very tired . I missed one pill but made sure I doubled up the next day and has been bleeding heavily for almost two weeks and have had painful cramps. column2: NyssaM, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: holymo, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

Everything seems the same other than the ironically absent periods.  I completely missed the first one and my second one was only one day long.  I took a pregnancy test after the first missed one and it was negative so I'm hoping the one day period is from the birthcontrol. Other than that works great

column2: Kiersmomma, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Notrel for 5 months now and i have gained 5lbs in 5months and i work out 4 days/wk. I am SUPER bloated feeling and constantly cramping. I am switching this week and i am so excited to give a new med a try.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Nortrel for four years and have not experienced the problems that other reviewers have mentioned. Generally, my periods have been lighter, acne isn't any worse or less of a problem, and no unusual headaches. And mood swings seem to be a problem with most birth control medications.

column2: liligg, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Well, i have been taking this form of birth control for about a year now and i seem to have a somewhat strange symptom-- i have absolutely no period when I'm taking this drug. My mom made me take a pregnancy test about a year ago and it came out negative. Is there anyone else who has the same side effect?

column2: Latoyia, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: My mother put me on this when I turned 16. Im not 23, about to turn 24, and since I stopped talking it, I have had problems getting pregnant. DO NOT RECOMMEND AT ALL.

column2: tchisu, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this pill for over 2 years. I've never had flawless skin but I noticed the acne got WORSE and more painful esp around my jaw line and chin. I don't get headaches from this but I have noticed a big change that no one else has mentioned... right after my period I have the most foul smelling discharge. I have NEVER had this issue before. (I was on Orthotricyclin Lo last but switched for insurance purposes.) It's so embarrassing!  Now that my employer is contributing to our HSA accounts I am switching back to Orthotricylin Lo - forking out the extra money will be worth it. This def was not the BC for me, but stuck with it because my insurance covered generics and it did it's job as far as preventing pregnancy but this has has some of the months awful & embarrassing side effects!

column2: hannah1, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: Sugar, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column2: soccergirl, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking this bc cuz i get ovarian cyst. But since i started taking it i have acne on my face more, headaches, spotting before my period, cramping more in between my period when i spot. the only good thing is that my periods are lighter and less cramps then.

column2: Kait831, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on just about every type of birth control out there, but Nortrel has so far been the best. After having a period that lasted over 2 months and being on birth control at the time, Nortrel made it stop! I've only experienced 2 adverse effects. I have experienced migraines for the first time in my life and each new pack causes mood changes. Like most, I follow the typical 3 weeks on and 1 week off, but for the first 2-5 days of each new pack I become extremely sensitive. I become moody and angry at the smallest things. Its not extremely difficult to deal with, but can be very upsetting to the people around me. Other than that, I really recommend it. Obviously not everyone will have the same issues.

column2: maranay, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I've been on Nortel 1/35/28 for 20 years, and for the last 18 years each month I get a bad migraine with my cycle that lasts 3 days with horrible tooth pain.  I've even contemplated a tooth extraction due to the severe pain, but I've tolerated the pain since Nortrel was so effective.  But in the last 2 months I've had 4 migraines. Nortrel did a completely effective job, and my periods were hardly evident, hardly any cramps, easy off and then on again to have my kids, and no other troubles other than the migraines, but I can't take the migraine pain anymore, and am finally getting off the pill.

column2: ravinglunatic, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this for one month and so far it is great.  After trying Loseasonique for a year, I had to get off it since I was bleeding more often than not (at one point for 6 weeks straight).  Normal periods, no spotting, and most importantly NO DEPRESSION.  I have been taking depression medication for 10 years for mood swings but it did not help.  After starting Nortrel, I noticed that I was even moodier when I took my Wellbutrin, so I started taking it every other day.  I was fine on the days I did not take Wellbutrin, so I have stopped completely. So as long as it works to keep me from getting pregnant, I couldn't be happier!!!

column2: swimkitty, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i spot all of the time and ive developed acne its disgusting.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Well im very happy w the fact that even if i miss a pill the nortrel is still efective as birth control is often not effective on the woman in my family. although when i miss just one pill and take two the next morning (as i normally take it at night)i still start my period. and i cramp. but as long as i am very persistent w remembering it its great. My acne has improved tremendously and i dont have any more or worse mood swings. and as long as i take it normally i have no problems other than the first month i got a yeast infection but i took proper meds and havnt had a prob since.

column2: galfonso, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column9: i have been on the rx for about a year and i have never had perfect skin but when it would get close to my period my skin would get really senstive and break out very where and with that i mean my chest and back!!! gross i have never had that before also i get horrible mirgrains without BC but even worse ones on this! my doc knew about my headach prob but still gave me this and i hate it i dont think its healthy to take pills for my head everyday???? most likely not! im going to switch to ortho tri-cyclen i hope that helps with my skin and my head!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was on Yaz before this pill, and I must say Nortrel is amazing. I didn't have any crazy mood swings or heavy bleeding like I did on Yaz. It works, and I still feel normal.

column2: melproper, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had been on a brand-name drug for about 3 years before this. Switched insurance and now the pharmacy gave me nortrel. My doctor had me taking the brand-name drug for 9 weeks at a time, then a week of the placebos. Supposedly it works exactly like seasonale only the drug is cheaper.Now I am trying to get my insurance company to cover the brand like I have been taking it before while still taking Nortrel. I switched to Nortrel after taking a week off from my period (which I don't usually get which I think is great because that means I don't get a week of migraine headaches with it.) Since starting Nortrel, I have had almost constant headaches. I missed a day on the pill, took 2 the next day, and got my period for a few weeks. I have had my period more during the 2 months I have been on Nortrel than I've had it in the past 6 months. The whole point of taking this birth control like this was to reduce my periods a year and I'm actually having more. Now I am trying to get a waiver from my insurance company so I can start taking the brand-name drug covered by insurance for 9 weeks at a time like I had been doing for the past 3 years. Until then, this is the only thing I can afford to do.

column2: cheerlda08, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Mere22, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My Pharmacy switched me to this pill, I had been taking Necon for years with no problems. The only positive thing about taking this pill was short periods, they lasted about 2 days. I did feel nauseous a few times and have had a few headaches. My face is now scarred from all of the deep zits and pimples. I would not reccommend this pill to anyone.

column2: berrynana, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Two weeks after starting this pill, I developed severe leg pain.  Two months into the pill I was diagnosed with a DVT. My doctor is 100% sure it was caused by this pill.  I am 50 yrs old.  Don't take this pill if you are over 35!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

Sick to my stomach EVERYDAY nearly vomitting but affraid to hurl the pill and therefore be pointless to take it.  HORRID cramps and spotting.. followed up with slight mood swings. column2: SpceCadet, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Unlike other reviewers, this pill has decreased my headaches, decreased acne and decreased flow. column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My periods did not change at all. the heaviness stayed the same. But this pill caused my periods to be 11 days long as opossed to the 7 day normal periods. But I would recommend this pill if you suffer from severe cramping and pain during your period.

column2: Leeania, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This is the first birth control pill I have been on and have had nothing but problems. Sure it does what it is supposed to but comes with headaches and weight gain. I've taken this pill for 2 years now and I am switching. I cannot wait to get off this pill.

column2: etc, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)

My one complaint is that I have to take the pill within about a 2-minute window at the same time every day, or I start spotting. Also, I've been taking this medication for about 5 years.

column2: aldag, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I just don't want to add another baby to the mix, but I'm definitely contacting my dr to get a different pill prescribed.  Hope this helps others!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I do have stomach cramps and breast tenderness and enlargement...but overall, it seems to work very well.

column2: 1dancer, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: ive been on the pill for a month. it occasionally makes me nauscious and i might have a lil acne, nothing to bad.  i took my last pill today and my pd still hasnt come. i worried i might be prego. so we will see if the pill works or not. it sure as hell better!

column2: 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: I have only been taking this pill for a month and I really hate it.  I'm already getting acne which I've NEVER had before.  I also got a yeast infection from taking this pill too.  I'm moody, gained weight, and have a dark patch on my foot.  It keeps you from getting pregnant but it makes you miserable.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I hate this birth control, i was on yaz before and i loved it, i didn't gain weight, i wasnt moody, i didn't have such blurry vision. Nortrel side effects for me are , bleeding through out a whole month beside 3 days, blurry vision, My breast were so sore and swallon, horrible cramps,  always tired during the day, can never sleep at night, just had tons and tons of problems, super emotional.. i would not recommend this birth control to anyone!  i've been on it fore 3 months.. and im planning of changing birth control.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took this pill because I was having trouble finding a birth control that did not give me mood swings, make me gain weight and would help ease my cramps. Overall the pill did what it was supposed to do - not get me pregnant. I did not gain any weight, my face did not break out, and my cramps were better, but not completely gone so I still had to take Advil (but not as frequently as before). The downside to this pill is that it made me get more migraines than before. I have suffered from migraines all my life, but as I have gotten older I get them less frequently. This pill has caused me to get almost 10 times as many migraines. I am definitely getting off of this pill asap and switching to a mini pill (aka the ones without estrogen). There is all of this new research out there stating that if you get migraines with auras and are taking birth control with estrogen you are more likely to suffer from a stroke. If you get migraines please talk to your doctor before you start any pill. Be your own advocate!

column2: j23, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i was on yazmine for about 6 months and it worked wonderfully for me. i had nice clear skin, lighter and shorter periods and no emotional problems. then i switched to nortrel and i immediately started having bad mood swings. i'm always so irritable. and the worst part is, i absolutely CANNOT get any sleep. i have the hardest time falling asleep every single night. i'm always tired during the daytime. and on top of that, i'd get a yeast infection the week before my period.  my doctor switched me to Aviane and i have yet to start it, but hopefully it doesn't give me any problems the way nortrel has.

I have been having acne problems.  I have always had perfect skin, but my face started becoming sensitive and then all of a sudden began breaking out.  I didn't know where it was coming from and something said check the side effects of this drug and when I did, it was one of the side effects.  I am just happy that now I know and my skin will go back to being flawless.  I highly discourage anyone from taking this pill.  It has been effective in timing my cycles, but so are other drugs that do not have such side effects.

column2: jesser39, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this pill for 4 months now and I have noticed that I have gotten really bad acne.  I never had any problem with acne, maybe an occassional zit, now it looks like I have craters all over my face!  I was previously on Yaz and it was perfect, but because they don't have a generic, and I don't have insurance, I am limited to my chooices.  I really want to change to a different pill!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Ortho Novum Since Febrauary and Have Never Had a Problem. They Switched it to this one and Now Im bleeding a week early??.. I have no sex drive except in sparatics.. I have migraines like crazy.. is this Normal??

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have not noticed cramping with this bc, I have however noticed I do get headaches often.  I have used this same pill for 3 years.  I am overall satisfied.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started taking thins 6 months ago. The cramps are still here, almost worse than they were before. And yes it has made my period shorter..but its painful on the one day i bleed. I would only recommend this to someone with problems of bleeding too much.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: This is the 5th birth control i've tried and absolutely the most painful! Ever since the first week I began this pill I have had constant, very painful hormone headaches. No matter how many advil/aleve/ibuprofen pills I take per day, the headache does NOT go away.  Also, I have missed taking a pill once or twice but followed protocol and took it first thing in the morning, as opposed to the previous night. I had spotting for the entire week to week and a half following the missed pill.  I have also had break-through spotting without missing any pills.  This spotting lasted several days to a week and a half as well.  I started taking birth control to releive bad cramping, but this pill has had zero effect on my cramps.  It has, however, shortened the duration of my periods and made my heaviest days lighter (that being the ONLY positive to this pill). I have stuck it out for almost 6 months to see if the headaches would disappear and my cramps would become less, but neither has happened.  I would not recommend this pill to anyone! and strongly warn against the headache side-effect!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: If you are only taking this pill to not get pregnant, technically it does work. But if you are taking it because of terrible monthly cramps or anything to lighten your period, it doesn't do. I actually had to call into work because my cramps actually got worse. I can't wait to get off of this terrible birth control! I'm always nauseas and now I accidentally missed one pill, but followed protocol as soon as I remembered, but I still ended up getting a terrible period that has so far lasted for almost 2 weeks! The second I'm almost positive that it's gone, it shows back up. It's absolutely horrible and would advise anyone against this pill. There are so many others...might as well spend the extra money and not be miserable all the time.
